conclusion: Calculate gravitational force exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass m after smaller sphere is removed.
Use principle of superposition and formula for gravitational force.
Gravitational force F1 by original sphere on point mass m is GMm/4R^2.
Mass of removed sphere M' is proportional to volume of removed sphere.
Volume of a sphere is 4/3 π r^3.
Volume of original sphere is 4/3 π R^3.
Volume of removed sphere is 1/6 π R^3.
Mass of removed sphere M' is 1/8 M.
Gravitational force F2 by removed sphere on point mass m is GMm/32R^2.
Net gravitational force F is difference between F1 and F2.
